name: miocene
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
from or referring to the period of time between about 23 and 5.3 million years ago : Two trends are apparent during the Miocene Period. He suggested Miocene deposits might reveal fossilized "missing links" of an aquatic or shoreline existence.
More examplesFewer examplesEruptions started under the sea, probably in the Miocene period some 20 million years ago.Several other scientists had agreed that the items had come from the Miocene strata.The earliest fossil record for the Hominoidea is in early Miocene deposits in East Africa.

Specific periods of time
the Miocene
the period of time between about 23 and 5.3 million years ago: The present glacial epoch began during the Miocene. Later in the Miocene, the hominoid fossil record becomes sparse in Africa.
More examplesFewer examplesGlobal climates started to cool late in the Miocene.They have a fossil history in this part of Mexico that extends back to the Miocene.The middle Miocene has long been held as one of the fundamental time intervals in development of the modern Antarctic ice sheets.
